OR
The $PersonRank wears a disturbing grin on his face. "Do me a favor and put up a good fight."
OR
"Nothing personal kid."

"This is $PersonRank $personName of the Anarakis Reparations Society, can I help you?"
OR
"We are in a bit of a hurry commander, if you have business please make it quick."

script: AddText "Embedded in a small cove to the side of this station's modest docking section, the primary market facilities of this base are similarly spartan, if pleasantly un-crowded. A few small shops have sprung up in dugouts around the quartermaster's office, butmost are selling personal goods or laughably small quantities of spacer-grade hardware." textGrayColor

AddText "The merchant district of this installation takes on the form of a large cave, done up in colored drapery to give it some air of civilization. Spacers and locals dart between establishments of all sizes built directly into the rock, offering a wide array of services, from street food carts to starship dealers." textGrayColor

AddText "The expansive promenade throngs with crowds, mostly Society personnel, but one can catch a glimpse of smuggler types and independent pirates working deals amongst one another. Though primarily a military installation, the relative lack of shipping regulation enforced by the Society draws in entrepreneurs from all walks of life." textGrayColor

AddText " In contrast to most other Society Installations, business on Anargaia is not handled at a modest, if accommodating trade district, but a spartan quartermaster's office. Most spacers to be seen are Society members, not entirely surprising given Anargaia's guarded existence, but the odd trader, mercenary, or diplomat still manages to stick out among the monotony. Despite the importance of this mobile port, the Society seems willing to share its advantages to those who have managed to befriend them" textGrayColor

text: The comlink opens up, the static clearing to reveal an all-too-familiar face, wearing an unfamiliar ear to ear grin. "Well well, fancy meeting you here, I guess I won't need to ask you about this strange little find after all, since I'll be taking it now." The pirate looks over at a console next to their chair before looking back to you. "It's in quite a rough shape too isn't it? I'll need about...lets say half of your fuel and supplies to get it back to the core worlds intact." The pirate leans forward and gives you a piercing glare. "Of course I don't think you're in any condition to stop me, so if you just hand it all over, I'd be inclined not to add murder to my list of deeds for this expedition, your choice."
